nodes.bodyText:
Does it work when it is instead written as YAML like the rest of the file?

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  - {key: "strimzi.io/kind", operator: In, values: ["Kafka", "KafkaConnect"]}
          
          
            
                  - key: strimzi.io/kind
          
          
            
                    operator: In
          
          
            
                    values: 
          
          
            
                      - Kafka
          
          
            
                      - KafkaConnect
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,8 @@ metadata:
     app: strimzi
 spec:
   selector:
-    matchLabels:
-      strimzi.io/kind: Kafka
+    matchExpressions:
+      - {key: "strimzi.io/kind", operator: In, values: ["Kafka", "KafkaConnect"]}

nodes.bodyText: Yes, it works in YAML form. I went ahead and changed it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,8 @@ metadata:
     app: strimzi
 spec:
   selector:
-    matchLabels:
-      strimzi.io/kind: Kafka
+    matchExpressions:
+      - {key: "strimzi.io/kind", operator: In, values: ["Kafka", "KafkaConnect"]}
